abstract: connector ramps planned for tomball tollway and grand parkway in 2019 .
article: the harris county toll road authority expects to start construction on four connectors along the grand parkway and tomball tollway in mid-2019 . the harris county commissioners court approved $ 2.5 million toward the design of the connectors along both roadways during a meeting on dec. . 12 . the hctra has been working along with the texas department of transportation on the project , said hctra spokesperson roxana sibrian . `` drivers will have the option to get directly on the grand parkway , reducing traffic volume and improving connectivity in the area , '' she said . according to a txdot traffic count conducted last year , rush hour traffic in the area occurs between 7 a. m. to 8 a. m. with an average of 1,000 vehicles and then 5 p. m. to 6 p. m. with about 800 vehicles .

while the design was approved , the budget for the construction project has not yet been announced . the commissioners court also approved the construction of the wilshire service center , which will consolidate various hctra departments that are scattered across the county into one location . `` more specifically this is to combine customer service call center , customer service training group with the customer service department , '' sibrian said . `` the building will also provide a dedicated space for hctra 's incident response team . `` the service center will be built in northwest houston , across the street from the administrative offices at 7701 wilshire place dr. sibrian said the agency has found it necessary to consolidate various department currently in different locations and provide a permanent space .
the new building will be about 70,000 square feet that will cost approximately $ 40 million and expects to be completed by the end of 2021 , sibrian said .
